activeIn_PRODUCTION_Info.note: Adding a more global cache tag

lastSaveWarnings.detail: When your `Origin Server` is set to NetStorage, enable Cache HTTP Error Responses with a TTL of at least 30 seconds.
The input to option Modified Path of `Site Failover` cannot be validated because of variable expression usage. Because of the use of variables, the value of the option is only known at runtime.
To ensure the `Site Failover` behavior works correctly, you should use it within a match such as Response Status Code or Origin Timeout.

Format validation is not applied to the input fields when using the Regular Expression Replacement option in `Modify Outgoing Request Path`. Please test thoroughly on Akamai's Staging Network when using this option. Do not hesitate to reach out to an Akamai Technical representative if you are uncertain about how this option is used.

Format validation is not applied to the input fields when using the Regular Expression Replacement option in `Modify Outgoing Request Path`. Please test thoroughly on Akamai's Staging Network when using this option. Do not hesitate to reach out to an Akamai Technical representative if you are uncertain about how this option is used.
When your `Origin Server` is set to NetStorage, enable Cache HTTP Error Responses with a TTL of at least 30 seconds.

Matching on `Metadata Stage` requires thorough understanding of the way Akamai Edge servers process requests, especially the order of metadata stage execution.  If you are unsure about how this will affect your property, please contact your Akamai Technical representative, and please test thoroughly on staging before activating on production.

options.description: Capture Akamai Reference Error from default header
options.xml:
<!-- REF ERROR CAPTURE -->
<edgeservices:modify-outgoing-response.add-error-reference-header>on</edgeservices:modify-outgoing-response.add-error-reference-header>

<match:metadata-stage value="client-response client-done">
    <match:response.header name="X-Reference-Error">
        <assign:extract-value>
            <location>Response_Header</location>
            <location-id>X-Reference-Error</location-id>
            <variable-name>PMUSER_REFERENCE_ERROR</variable-name>
        </assign:extract-value>
    </match:response.header>
</match:metadata-stage>

<match:metadata-stage value="client-response client-done">
	<match:variable name="DO_EDGECONNECT_PUBLISH" value="on">
	    <match:variable name="ENT_EDGECONNECT_NO_DLR_NEEDED" value="on" result="false">
	        <assign:variable>
	            <name>EDGECONNECT_CUSTOM_DATA</name>
	            <value>{"CustomData":{"cache-key":"%(AK_ARL)","hashreferer":"%(PMUSER_REFERERHASH)"}}</value>
	        </assign:variable>
	    </match:variable>
	</match:variable>
</match:metadata-stage>

options.description: Enable IPA request to alternate origin
options.xml:
<!-- Enable IPA request to alternate origin -->
<match:metadata-stage value="client-request-body">  
  <edgeservices:processing-agent>
    <log-r-line>on</log-r-line>
    <host>ipa-www.jaescalo.com</host>
    <url>/credentials.txt</url>
  </edgeservices:processing-agent>
</match:metadata-stage>

children.name: IPA Origin
children.comments: Using the same as the default origin just for demo.

options.xml:
<!-- Check if the IPA response is 200 or not and set status variables. -->
<match:processing-agent-response host="ipa-www.jaescalo.com">
  <match:regex select="IPA_RESPONSE_STATUS" regex=".*">  
    <assign:variable>  
      <name>ET_RESP_HTTP_STATUS</name>  
      <value>%(AK_SELECT)</value>  
    </assign:variable>  
  </match:regex>  
   
  <match:response.status value="200" result="true">
    <assign:variable>
      <name>PMUSER_IPA_STATUS</name>
      <value>true</value>
    </assign:variable>
    <match:regex flags="so" impl="re2" strict-err-check-re2="on"  regex="(.*)" select="IPA_RESPONSE_BODY" variable-list="ORIGIN_RESPONSE_BODY">
      <assign:variable>
        <name>NS_GOOD_RESPONSE_BODY</name>
        <value>YES</value>
        <sensitive>off</sensitive>
      </assign:variable>
    </match:regex>
  </match:response.status>
  
  <match:response.status value="200" result="false">
    <assign:variable>
      <name>PMUSER_IPA_STATUS</name>
      <value>false</value>
    </assign:variable>
  </match:response.status>
</match:processing-agent-response>

options.description: Metadata to validate and extract values from JWT.
options.xml:
<!-- JWT extraction from header X-API-KEY -->
<assign:extract-value>
    <variable-name>X_API_KEY</variable-name>
    <location>Client_Request_Header</location>
    <location-id>X-API-KEY</location-id>
</assign:extract-value>

<!-- JWT definition 1 based on RS256 -->
<edgeservices:jwt.definition>
    <status>on</status>
    <id>def1</id>

    <claim>
        <name>alg</name>
        <header>on</header>
        <value>RS256</value>
    </claim>
</edgeservices:jwt.definition>

<!-- JWT definition 2 (for 2nd key) based on RS256 -->
<edgeservices:jwt.definition>
    <status>on</status>
    <id>def2</id>

    <claim>
        <name>alg</name>
        <header>on</header>
        <value>RS256</value>
    </claim>
</edgeservices:jwt.definition>

<!-- First public key definition. Generate with commands: 
    $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 2048 -m PEM -f jwt_key_1.key
    $ openssl rsa -in jwt_key_1.key -pubout -outform PEM -out jwt_key_1.key.pub -->
<edgeservices:jwt.key-definition>
    <id>key1</id>
    <value>-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
        MIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8AMIIBCgKCAQEAx4IkplJGw+hVYclvXnVh
        GHKoyPTHTAgJuS/lFgmckwco4LglWG2auy0/dnEH+bOxp0qbbtErWoTtYs1DZA/N
        3kYNS6Kq5T5o57zuIYaFzh4Xsozc+8ISA6ygUbPZIDfZ7P2EEn6Cm9rrXVo2Y1KT
        BoUzAac7/ux0KO2Ze4cpbWwDk7NbIBx0yQCz7DMlg7hoiqNKLoz2XtXwGMdYNT3n
        FLSf56XdMmHk69rtsPx/9/D2xGM6qI23tCCSwFq9facs9j7mN37MEoj38o1UAHbb
        2S7T2L0i6dU8OTj4RUszKzEQz0GdDUV+k9teUnGIn4u9t4l/eD+v00ykpHmfagE7
        KwIDAQAB
        -----END PUBLIC KEY-----</value>
</edgeservices:jwt.key-definition>

<!-- Second public key definition. -->
<edgeservices:jwt.key-definition>
    <id>key2</id>
    <value>-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
        MIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8AMIIBCgKCAQEApPP+M2ZXE87Y3Kkuea4t
        MStoNDjaLM73Io2OCptIGJOBm0Sg/1O0l1dxbcvn9s6Mq/hlzLKtA1Y6V1yC5X+E
        lvacxl3TncGUjSNNo1YSSggO3WDje+pqfMqWSR+k1H8R/tNt8PH9p2wS9NDR4PXK
        F/d1Gb6QwJ/aQ3clQkvGRybYHPCnXLmcoXkS5YyxFthnwgqvl0+NvVCrEH9K8zgL
        uHEO5Pk4FnDVmQ/TSiuYgMOVjZhMsWldSmE5RuwVi7igpW93S5jsxTmOAekNpq3n
        92rMYLlpls42oxlbUSgKJZrVHMM+N0SLj8svF7kY4JrtI8AnKhAOF9tX1yS5h6v4
        1wIDAQAB
        -----END PUBLIC KEY-----</value>
</edgeservices:jwt.key-definition>

<!-- First JWT validation with first public key definition -->
<match:jwt.validate token="%(X_API_KEY)" result="false" def-id="def1" key-id="key1" reason="JWT_REASON">
    <assign:variable>
        <name>JWT_KEY_1_INVALID</name>
        <value>true</value>
    </assign:variable>
</match:jwt.validate>

<!-- Second/Backup JWT validation with first public key definition -->
<match:variable name="JWT_REASON" value="invalid_signature">
    <match:jwt.validate token="%(X_API_KEY)" result="false" def-id="def2" key-id="key2" reason="JWT_REASON">
        <assign:variable>
            <name>JWT_KEY_2_INVALID</name>
            <value>true</value>
        </assign:variable>
        <auth:acl.deny>%(JWT_REASON)</auth:acl.deny>
    </match:jwt.validate>
</match:variable>

<!-- Forward some headers to the client based on extracted claims from the JWT -->
<edgeservices:modify-outgoing-response.add-header>
    <name>JWT_IAT</name>
    <value>%(JWT_IAT)</value>
</edgeservices:modify-outgoing-response.add-header>

<edgeservices:modify-outgoing-response.add-header>
    <name>JWT_AUD</name>
    <value>%(JWT_AUD)</value>
</edgeservices:modify-outgoing-response.add-header>

value.comments: The behaviors in the Default Rule apply to all requests for the property hostname(s) unless another rule overrides the Default Rule settings.

lastSaveWarnings.detail: One or more Caching behaviors may not work as expected due to Advanced behaviors or Advanced Override matching expression //cache:bypass. Consult your account representative or see Advanced for more information.

lastSaveWarnings.title: Unstable rule format
lastSaveWarnings.detail: This property is using `latest` rule format, which is designed to reflect interface changes immediately. We suggest converting the property to a stable rule format such as `v2021-09-22` to minimize the risk of interface changes breaking your API client program.
